messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/20/03 4:34:53 PM, joylyn@earthlink.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/20/03 4:34:53 PM, joylyn@... writes:

<< Sandra, I'd love to spend a bit
of time with you, maybe going to the mall to piss my dad off (cause
don't you know the homeschool kids in Alb. just spend all their time at
the mall!) ;-) >>

Okay, but it needs to be after I get back from South Carolina, which is
Tuesday a week and a half after the HSC conference. So don't drive too fast!!

How long will you be with your parents and hereabout?

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: a trip
messages.msgSnippet: the more I look at this site the moreI want to go.  I hope they have nice tent camp sites.  We d love to have company Peggy, or anyone, if you d like to join
messages.messageBody:
the more I look at this site the moreI want to go. I hope they have
nice tent camp sites. We'd love to have company Peggy, or anyone, if
you'd like to join us.

Joylyn

ps, as I'm planning this trip my dad is helping. I can tell he's
working really hard, successfully, to not say a word about me camping
alone in a tent with two children. My mom did say that some of the
driving would be hard with one driver, but that was all. I'm proud of
my parents, they are coming a long way.

messages.msgSnippet: ... Perhaps you d like to meet us here for some camping? http://www.pr.state.az.us/parkhtml/homolovi.html I haven t called for availability but we will be
messages.messageBody:
Peggy wrote:

>
>
> Northern part of Arizona? We'd sure like to see you guys, not that
> August is the best season to come and visit. ;)

Perhaps you'd like to meet us here for some camping?

http://www.pr.state.az.us/parkhtml/homolovi.html

I haven't called for availability but we will be pulling in on the
afternoon of the 22nd of August, leaving mid morning the 23rd, our plan
is to set up camp (tent camping) and then visit the ruins at dusk, and
again in the am, trying to leave by 11am to go to Alb. How does this sound?

Joylyn

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: **And Betsy, do come, at least let s get together sometime! You re not that far! Actually, our big Crawdad feast here on the farm will be in September ** Hi,
messages.messageBody:
**And Betsy, do come, at least let's get together sometime! You're not that
far! Actually, our big Crawdad feast here on the farm will be in
September **

Hi, Dar --

I'll plan to get tickets for Peter Pan the second weekend. Maybe I can
see you then. If you aren't going to attend every single show, then let
me know which ones you'll be at.

I've heard of the legendary crawdad festivities because I used to
subscribe to Heather Madrone's Home-Ed list. I was a lurker there and
didn't really feel like part of the group. But I pressed my nose
against the window some.

Betsy

no, but she's OK with that. ;-)

hotel, would that work? We would have our tent if necessary. Elizabeth
may be with us though..... The alternative is to go straight up to
Donner pass on Sunday night.

We should probably move this to private email.

Joylyn

> for a show the last week in August at a different theater, so we'd be

> this summer but it hasn't happened yet - I'll let you know!
>
> Dar

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/20/03 8:48:03 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Isn t she just awesome? We are currently in love with the holiday song, which right now the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/20/03 8:48:03 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
freeform@... writes:

> We like The Pothead Song, too... it has a longer name, something with
> poignant and pointless and co-ed in the title, but everyone calls it The
> Pothead Song.
>
> Dar
>

Isn't she just awesome? We are currently in love with the holiday song, which
right now the song title escapes me, but it's the one where the Pagan niece
calls the Christian Uncle and has dinner at his home during Winter
Solstice/Christmas.

Kass and Kree find so many questions prompted by her songs, by most music
overall. It can be breath-taking and heartbreaking all rolled into those
conversations, but I think I am most grateful that they truly listen to all the music
we enjoy and want to understand the perplexities of society because of some
great lyrics. Just Friday, while at another homeschooler's birthday party, we
(adults) discussed music and it's effects on our society. We, DH & I, do not
censor the music the girls listen to, but rather try to learn what it is the
singer/songwriters are trying to say with them. I knew I would get a few eyeballs
popping out when I said that during the party. Not everyone understands why we
don't censor their music as most parents I know do censor their kids music.
Of course I have difficulty from the unschooler's perspective, especially when
music is not "allowed" for some kids due to the lyrics, but I accept that not
everyone is willing to subject themselves to hear things they are convinced as
just negativity to sell records. It just isn't that way for us, we see that
most songs are a story and generally have something to be gained, even those
drenched in profanity. Kass & Kree don't understand such censorship yet, maybe
they never will, since they haven't been subjected to that and may never be.

Rhonda - who by the way Dar, after I posted those lyrics and hit send I
thought, wow, what if SHE is the same Dar??? Then I thought, Oh crap if she is I
sure hope I got those lyrics right. LOL


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think I like that one best, too. I don t really like the musical version because it doesn t attemt to explain why Wendy and her brothers would be so
messages.messageBody:
On Sun, 20 Jul 2003 22:55:55 EDT rjhill241@... writes:
>My absolute favorite is
> "Hook" when Robin Williams played Peter. I both laugh and cry
> everytime we watch it.

I think I like that one best, too. I don't really like the musical
version because it doesn't attemt to explain why Wendy and her brothers
would be so eager to fly off to Neverland - in the book, Wendy is to be
moved out of the nursery the next day, and this is her last night as a
child, and she flies off so she doesn't have to grow up. *That* makes
sense.

Rain would love to be Peter ::sigh:::

>Then this week a friend gave me a Dar Williams CD to listen to,
> specifically because of the gender song "When I was a Boy".

I *love* that song. The first time I heard Dar Williams was 6 or 7 years
ago, when she opened for Joan Baez, and she sung that one, and I went
right out and bought the cassette. Rain loved "The Babysitter's Here" -
she was 4ish - and she still does the spinach line from that one whenever
we have spinach. And yes, most people IRL actually call me Daron, and I
didn't shorten it to Dar I heard her song (although hers is short for
Darlene, I believe, and in the world of musical theater I'm the one they
assign to the dancing or acting stuff, not the singing!).

We like The Pothead Song, too... it has a longer name, something with
poignant and pointless and co-ed in the title, but everyone calls it The
Pothead Song.

Dar

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/20/03 5:05:21 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Hello Joylyn and Dar and everyone else!!! I have always loved Peter Pan. I always wanted to go
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/20/03 5:05:21 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
joylyn@... writes:

> But Lexie doesn't LIKE Peter Pan, and NEVER did. just ask her. Of
> course, we crack up laughing, which makes her even more mad. For those
> not in the know, when LExie was about two we had to call her Peter, she
> loved Peter Pan so much. She wouldn't answer to Lexie, only to Peter.
> My dad, the counselor, was concerned and thought we shouldn't play
> along. I shrugged it off saying if she still wanted to change her name
> to Peter and was pretending to fly at 22, we'd worry.

Hello Joylyn and Dar and everyone else!!!

I have always loved Peter Pan. I always wanted to go to Neverland, but hated
the thought of leaving my mommy and daddy behind. My absolute favorite is
"Hook" when Robin Williams played Peter. I both laugh and cry everytime we watch
it. Then this week a friend gave me a Dar Williams CD to listen to,
specifically because of the gender song "When I was a Boy". My friend put the CD in while
we were driving and said, "Really listen to this one..." and sure enough when
the song eneded I was balling, the twins were in deep contemplation over the
lyrics and my girlfriend both smiled and apologized simultaneously and said,
"I knew you would react this way."

Here are the lyrics:

When I was a Boy by Dar Williams

I won't forget when Peter Pan came to house, took my hand
I said I was a boy, I'm glad he didn't check
I learned to fly, I learned to fight
I lived a whole life in one night
We saved each other's lives out on a Pirate's deck

And I remeber that night
When I'm leaving a late night with some friends
And I hear somebody tell me it's not safe, someone should help me
I need to find a nice man to walk me home

When I was a boy, I scared the pants off my mom
Climbed what I could climb upon
And I don't know how I survived,
I guess I knew the tricks that all boys knew
And you can walk me home but I was a boy, too

I was a kid you would like, just a small boy on her bike
Riding topless, yeah, I never cared who saw
My neighbor came outside to say, "Get your shirt,"
I said "No way, it's the last time I'm not breaking any law"

And now I'm in a clothing store, and the sign says less is more
More that's tight means more to see, more for them, not more for me
That can't help climb a tree in ten seconds flat

When I was a boy, see that picture? That was me
Grass-stained shirt and dusty knees
And I know things have gotta change,
They got pills to sell, they've got implants to put it, they've got implants
to remove
But I am not forgetting
That I was Boy too

And like the woods where I would creep, it's a secret I can keep
Except when I'm tired, except when I'm being caught off guard
I've had a lonesome awful day, the conversation finds its way
To catching fire-flies out in the backyard

And I tell that man I'm with about the other life I lived
And I say now, "You're top gun, I have lost and you have won"
And he say's, "Oh no, no can't you see?
When I was a girl, my mom and I always talked
And I picked flowers everywhere that I walked
And I could always cry, now even when I'm alone I seldom do
And I have lost some kindness
But I was a girl too
And you were just like me , and I was just like you."

I am sure just reading the lyrics is not anywhere near is gripping as hearing
it sung, but beautiful none the less.

See you and yours in Neverland,
Rhonda - who is gonna search out her copy of Hook


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh, that s very funny! Somehow Lexie will always be inextricably linkd with Peter Pan in m mind, no matter what she says... ... But there are no
messages.messageBody:
On Sun, 20 Jul 2003 17:03:06 -0700 Joylyn <joylyn@...> writes:
> And now she claims she NEVER EVER even thought of liking Peter Pan
> the movie.

Oh, that's very funny! Somehow Lexie will always be inextricably linkd
with Peter Pan in m mind, no matter what she says...

>Of course, Janene is TOTALLY into Peter Pan.

But there are no elephants...?

>When is the
> show?
> Tell me more.

It's at the Varsity theater in Davis for two weekends, the weekend of the
15th and the 22nd. It's a workshop production so they double cast, so
they double cast the main roles, plus the director changed the rehearsal
schedule around and Rain had previous commitments, and so was told that
she then couldn't be cast in a lead role because she'd miss too many
rehearsals. I was sort of irked, but we'll see, casting isn't until next
week. She'll be in it, and lots of her friends will be in it, and that's
enough for her...

And Betsy, do come, at least let's get together sometime! You're not that
far! Actually, our big Crawdad feast here on the farm will be in
September (the date is not quite firm yet, but either the 3rd or 4th
weekend), and that's always much fun. I'm going to try to get tie dye
stuff again - which reminds me, Joylyn, the Dharma Trading Co. store in
in San Rafael, kinda sorta not too far out of your way... I'm assuming
that if you're driving up for the conference you won't be up again for
crawdads. :(

> Could you come camping with us? We have a large
> enough
> tent, we'd just need you to bring sleeping bags.

Possibly - Rain's auditioning for another show this week and if she gets
the parts she'll take, she'd be in rehearsal then, but if she doesn't
(and she's only willing to take a couple of roles) she'll be auditioning
for a show the last week in August at a different theater, so we'd be
free until then. It sounds like fun, we've been wanting to go camping
this summer but it hasn't happened yet - I'll let you know!

Dar

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: Now Kelly.  I did say I d try my best. They may be all in a row. LOL! Barb E Read, every day, something that no one else is reading. Think, every day,
messages.messageBody:
Now Kelly. <eg> I did say I'd try my best. They may be all in a row.
LOL!


Barb E
Read, every day, something that no one else is reading.
Think, every day, something that no one else is thinking.
Do, every day, something no one else would be silly enough to do.
It is bad for the mind to continually be part of unanimity.
~Christopher Morley

to make you like everybody else.

E.E. Cummings

"Youth is not a time of life; it is a state of mind; it is
not a matter of rosy cheeks, red lips and supple knees; it
is a matter of the will, quality of the imagination, a

springs of life. "

- Samuel Ullman, Businessman and Poet

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] a trip
messages.msgSnippet: But Lexie doesn t LIKE Peter Pan, and NEVER did. just ask her.  Of course, we crack up laughing, which makes her even more mad.  For those not in the know,
messages.messageBody:
But Lexie doesn't LIKE Peter Pan, and NEVER did. just ask her. Of
course, we crack up laughing, which makes her even more mad. For those
not in the know, when LExie was about two we had to call her Peter, she
loved Peter Pan so much. She wouldn't answer to Lexie, only to Peter.
My dad, the counselor, was concerned and thought we shouldn't play
along. I shrugged it off saying if she still wanted to change her name
to Peter and was pretending to fly at 22, we'd worry. Of course, it
passed and she became Lexie again (although now she wants to be Rose).
And now she claims she NEVER EVER even thought of liking Peter Pan the
movie. Of course, Janene is TOTALLY into Peter Pan. When is the show?
Tell me more. Could you come camping with us? We have a large enough
tent, we'd just need you to bring sleeping bags.

Joylyn

messages.subject: a trip
messages.msgSnippet: in august I will be traveling for about 2 1/;2 weeks and would love to meet some of you. I will be going to the HSC conference, then over to camp at Donner
messages.messageBody:
in august I will be traveling for about 2 1/;2 weeks and would love to
meet some of you.

I will be going to the HSC conference, then over to camp at Donner pass
for a day or two, then down to Vegas for a night or two, then over
across Arizona, spending the night in Winslow I think, then to New
Mexico, Alb. and the Jemez Mountains. Sandra, I'd love to spend a bit
of time with you, maybe going to the mall to piss my dad off (cause
don't you know the homeschool kids in Alb. just spend all their time at
the mall!) ;-) Anyone else on that road?

Joylyn
